programme.title: Marc Márquez: More than a Comeback
programme.desc: After 2,184 days, 108 crashes, six surgeries and 30 missed Grands Prix, Marc Marquez has once again claimed the MotoGP World Championship title, doing so for an astonishing seventh time. But it’s been more than a comeback for the Spanish rider, who has endured his own personal calvary over the past six years. Through exclusive interviews with Marc, his friends and family, and never-before-seen footage, this 30-minute documentary provides previously unheard perspectives on the highs and lows of the Spaniard’s arduous journey back to the top of Grand Prix motorcycle racing

programme.title: Special Coverage Arab Cup FIFA Qatar 2025
programme.desc: The second edition of the FIFA Arab Cup is scheduled to be held in Qatar from December 1 to 18, 2025. The tournament will be hosted across six venues, all of which were utilized during the FIFA World Cup™ three years prior. As with Qatar 2022, Al Bayt Stadium will host the tournaments opening match, while the prestigious Lusail Stadium will serve as the venue for the final. Stay updated with comprehensive coverage of the Arab Cup Qatar 2025 on BeIN Sports News.

programme.title: Paris vs Chambery - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.
